result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $2314.00 to Debra F.

Court ordered the DNA surcharge wavied due to the defendant's limited income and the restitution and costs that must be paid. Pay all remaining costs, assessments and surcharges; If the defendant is revoked, Court ordered that the restitution, costs and surcharges be paid out of up to 25% of prison accounts and to be collected and distributed by the Department of Corrections; balance to be paid during extended supervision; if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Court ordered the restitution be paid first.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
No contact with John D. or Debra F.

Referred to the Mental Health Unit for assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Take all prescribed meds by treating physician.
Cooperate with agent--no new violations of the law which rises to the level of probable cause.
Court advised the defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: May earn GOOD TIME; release for the Day Reporting Center for treatment and other programming.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Montrell Patterson

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA/SENTENCING Transcript (44 pages) commencing 07/08/2014 by FRANCINE O'CLAIRE.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in court with attorney James T. Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Court advised the defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.   Parties review report submitted by Robert Rawski.  There being no challenge to the report dated 6-12-14 by the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Bail as ordered prior to proceedings being suspended.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  


  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
dated 6-12-14 authored by Robert Rawski, received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea and sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.  Court steps out to allow defense time to confer with the defendant.  Back on the record.  Court is advised by defense counsel that there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  The court suspended the proceedings and ordered the defendant be examined by the Department of Health Services.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson not in court, in custody.  Jescia Ballenger for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Debra F

Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Montrell Patterson in custody.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
